general.headline: Special Counsel at McCabe Curwood Lawyers
general.description:
Laura has acted for major insurers since 2006 and continued as a lawyer from 2009.

Laura was first exposed to insurance litigation as a Claims Advisor at Allianz assisting in indemnity and legally represented soft tissue files. 

Laura accepted a role with a Defendant law firm and practiced in the areas of motor recoveries, property damage recoveries, public liability, personal injury and compulsory third party (CTP) 

Since joining Curwoods (now McCabe Curwood) the majority of Laura's matters involve the management of CTP files in the District Court of NSW and in CARS, which involve complex liability and quantum issues. Laura is committed to the commercial resolution of all her claims and acts in the interests of her various insurer clients. 

In her spare time she is a Rotarian (Rotary Club of Darling Harbour), costume designer (Stooged Theatre) and a self-proclaimed DIY expert.

jobs.description:
Laura acts for a number of CTP insurers in a variety of CTP claims, including claims involving procedural issues such as nominal defendant claims, late claims, and claims involving s 151Z recovery actions.

Laura has presented a number of seminars to CTP clients on topics ranging from the strategic management of late claims, the effective use of surveillance, declining liability/reducing payments, MAS Reviews, contributory negligence, and consider your forum: CARS v Court.

Laura has acted for Insurers for in the areas of CTP, public liability, and motor and property recovery claims.

Laura's commenced as a Paralegal before she was admitted as a Solicitor in December 2009.

Her role involved drafting advices, advising clients of developments and the preparation of a matter for Hearings in the District and Supreme Courts as well as the CARS Jurisdiction. The majority of my role involves the management of Public Liability and CTP files.

Laura commenced at Allianz working with the Business
Improvement Manager for the CTP Division. She worked on various projects involving a wide variety of tasks including; legal research, auditing, data integrity and archiving.

She subsequently took on an Administrative Assistant role before 
transferring to a Claims Advisor position in the Directs team (self-
represented claimants). Later she was allocated legally represented, soft tissue files. 

Her role was to manage a portfolio of CTP personal injury claims. Whilst in this position she initiated procedures to improve the claims management process.

An influential and experienced business lobbyist, Mary Massina has carved out a unique career
across the public, private and community sectors, as well as within the political sphere.

politics to deliver measurable results.

My career reflects a successful track record of leadership roles in strong corporate environments and project delivery with large scale listed entities.

My professional strengths lie in strategic planning complex projects creating pathways for success and team leadership which empowers diversity, innovation and creativity in teams.  My practised experience in successful projects and business environment demonstrates a commercial orientation – drives, encourages and creates commercial opportunities by building cross functional, intercompany and external partnerships.

I have held Leadership / General Management / Divisional Roles - in both Australia and New Zealand - most notably as CEO / Country Leadership – 8 years as head of a Westfield's Shopping Centre and Development in NZ business with full P&L responsibility with a turnover of $240million, staff of over 200.

general.headline: Finance & Commercial Director at Northwest Rapid Transit
general.description: I am a senior infrastructure sector executive with considerable investment / finance, project management and commercial experience developed over the last 30 years. My career has spanned a diverse set of industries and functions in each of large, small to medium and start up enterprises, currently as Finance & Commercial Director for Northwest Rapid Transit (delivering Sydney Metro Northwest) and immediately prior to that as a Director of leading infrastructure developer, Capella Capital.

jobs.description:
I am the Finance and Commercial Director for Northwest Rapid Transit (NRT), the entity that is delivering the Sydney Metro Northwest Rail PPP project for Transport for NSW.

The $8.3 billion Sydney Metro Northwest is Australia’s biggest public transport project currently under construction.

Sydney Metro Northwest will be Australia’s first fully-automated rapid transit rail network, delivering 8 new railway stations, 4,000 new commuter car parking spaces and 5 existing railway stations upgraded to rapid transit status.

The NSW Government has awarded the $3.7 billion Operations, Trains and Systems contract to Northwest Rapid Transit (NRT).

This Public Private Partnership is the largest ever awarded in NSW and will see the NRT consortium deliver the Sydney Metro Northwest by the first half of 2019 and operate and maintain it for the next 15 years.

Next generation rapid transit trains on the Sydney Metro Northwest will start with 15 trains an hour during the peak (a train every 4 minutes) and 98 precent on-time running.

The Sydney Metro Northwest is the first stage of the new Sydney Rapid Transit network and will transform and modernise public transport in Sydney forever. 

The project features:

Construction of 23km of new electrified, twin track, rapid transit railway between Tallawong Road, Rouse Hill and Epping.

Upgrading the existing 13km Epping to Chatswood railway to rapid transit standards, including the existing stations at Epping (lower level), Macquarie University, Macquarie Park, North Ryde and Chatswood (rapid transit platforms).

Australia’s longest rail tunnels – 15km long and up to 58m below ground at their deepest point. 

Between Bella Vista and Rouse Hill, a 4km elevated skytrain is being built, followed by 4km of bridges, embankments and surface tracks to the terminus.

A Rapid Transit Rail Facility to allow trains to be cleaned, maintained and parked at night and off peak is being built at Tallawong Road, Rouse Hill.

We also undertake to identify the needs of the candidate and implement processes that ensure that these needs, at present and in to the future, are met.

general.headline: CEO at Women in Banking and Finance (WiBF), Non Exec Director, CA / CPA finance professional and perpetual change maker.
general.description:
As the newly appointed CEO of Women in Banking and Finance, I am responsible for activating the WiBF vision, which is to support our member organisations in growing and promoting the talent pipeline of professional women in the industry. 

WiBF is a not-for-profit association aimed at improving gender diversity and inclusion in the banking and finance sector, and currently has over 50 corporate members covering a broad cross section of the financial services industry. For more information, visit www.wibf.org.au.

My career to date has been quite an adventure, spanning 25 years, international borders and a host of blue-chip companies. With a strong background in banking, consulting and diversity, I've been at the forefront of the gender agenda for over a decade - as a senior executive, management consultant and CEO.  

A CA and FCPA qualified finance professional, I also hold an MBA from the AGSM, am a Graduate of the Company Directors Course and an accredited coach with the Institute of Executive Coaching and Leadership.  

I have ten years’ experience on Boards in the financial services, agricultural and education sectors; and have founded three start-up businesses.

Please don't hesitate to reach out if I can be of further assistance with your diversity and inclusion plans, or if you’d like to arrange a time to chat.

jobs.jobTitle: CEO - Women in Banking & Finance, Australia
jobs.description:
Women in Banking and Finance (WiBF) is a non‐profit association whose members have a passion for making a tangible impact on gender diversity and inclusion in the banking and finance sector. The focus on results, action and innovation has arisen through close industry consultation and is underpinned by the strength of the business case for diversity.

WiBF's programs have been designed to grow the pipeline of women across the mid to senior career stages of the wider financial services sector. By dissecting topical issues and challenges, the customised programs, top tier events and strategic networks assist members in meeting their business objectives. The association promotes the fundamental idea that diversity, inclusion and innovation drive personal and organisational development. 

The industry is committed to systemic and sustainable change, and WIBF currently has over 50 corporate members covering a broad cross section of the financial services industry. WIBF is overseen by a Board currently comprising twelve non-executive members. These members are nominated and elected from the broader member base.

For further information go to 
www.wibf.org.au

jobs.jobTitle: The Change Coach: Strategist, Coach (IECL accredited), Speaker on change.
jobs.description:
Put simply, I'm a change agent. I work with individuals and teams to define the change that will deliver the outcomes they seek, and then execute on that pathway effectively.  

Working one-on-one or with teams, and through facilitating workshops and strategic planning sessions, my job is to ensure each and every client understands what needs to be done to achieve the results that they want; have a clear pathway to get there; are kept on track; and inspired to realise their full potential.

My style is practical and pragmatic, drawing on my many and varied experiences from over 20-years of international leadership experience, in finance and management consulting in top-tier firms and blue-chip companies, and as entrepreneur and founder of three thriving businesses.

Some of my clients include:
American Express,  AMP Capital Investors, Asteron, ClubsNSW, Corporate Express, CPA Australia, Ernst & Young, Lundbeck Australia, Mirvac, Monash City Council, NAB, Pittwater Council, PwC Women in Transactions, SA Department for Water, The Growth Faculty, Tresscox Lawyers, Westpac and many more.

In a former business, sphinxx, I spent years working with leading edge organisations to create gender-balanced workplaces and communities and this remains a common thread in my work; for both men AND women deserve to realize their full potential and have true choice, happiness and meaning in their lives.  

I've led teams as large as 200 people; been responsible for $9billion in funds under administration; managed projects with $50million budgets; written and published a book and contributed to several others; been on the 40 Young Business Leaders List; and represented Australia in a BBC global debate on the advancement of women and the Millennium Goals and the Women’s Summit hosted by Malaysia’s Minister for Women.

Why not connect and let's have a chat about the challenges that you will conquer in 2018.

Find out more at www.jendalitz.com

general.headline: Director - Australian Human Resource Professionals
general.description:
James is committed to assisting organisations better understand and resolve their people and capability needs. He has a deep understanding of workplace and organisational dynamics, with over 25 years of experience in senior roles across the public, private and member-based organisations.

He started his career in what was personnel in the late 80's and after studying law, moved onto work with the Workplace Research Centre at the University of Sydney.  He has also worked for both the Public Sector Union and the Media Entertainment and Arts Alliance where he gaining practical experience in industrial relations & employment law (including negotiating agreements across sectors of the Australian economy) 

He went onto work in a number of roles where he was responsible for business developing, project-managing and delivered talent management and human resource solutions for a number of private and listed companies such as Hudson.  

Going on to work for himself he focused on facilitating sensitive organisational change processes and mediated challenging workplace conflicts. He also enjoys designing and delivering forums investigating critical issues in the world of work such as the workplace implications of family violence.

James holds a BA (ANU) and LLB (UNSW) qualifications and has completed the Leadership in Action program (Uni of Melb). He is a Nationally Accredited Mediator (NMAS) and accredited in the Team Management Profile. He is a Member of the Resolution Institute (RI), a Professional Member of the Institute of Managers and Leaders (he sits on the Regional Advisory Committee). He also holds a Certificate IV in Workplace Training and Assessment.

Connect via: james@ahrp.com.au | twitter @JamesAJudge | +61 (2) 6182 0067 | +61 (0) 434 265 459 

Specialties #Mediation #ConflictResolution #Facilitation #HumanResources #HRAdvice #HR #HRHealthCheck #LearningandDevelopment #L&D #TrainingandDevelopment #Engagement

We help companies to increase their productivity by maximising diversity. Providing support and professional development for educators enables the best possible outcome for every child. You can be confident that every C&K service:

- Employs qualified educators

I work closely with C&K kindergartens, long daycare services and affiliated services to find high quality educators for all positions. All permanent and relief vacancies are advertised on our website: http://www.candk.asn.au/.

Randstad’s company mission is “Shaping the world of work.” In the work we do every day, in the world of human resources, we contribute to the communities in which we live and work. For our clients, we focus on providing the best talent and allowing them to achieve their business objectives by focusing on core activities. Here at Randstad Education, we work closely with both our candidates and clients to ensure that we are finding that perfect match. schools.description: The Bachelor of Criminology at UNE is an inter-disciplinary degree that draws upon areas of study such as criminology, forensic science, law and criminal justice, and the sociology of deviance. Students are able to choose a number of core and elective units that examine criminal law and procedures, policing, punishment, prisons, forensic science, theories of crime, rural crime and juvenile delinquency. The degree also offers students the opportunity to undertake training in research methods and provides hands-on experience within the criminal justice system through our Work Ready program. Graduates of a Bachelor of Criminology can seek employment in a wide-range of sectors, including: border control, correctional facilities, crime prevention agencies, government and policy agencies, intelligence and security, juvenile justice, police service and welfare.
Will complete the Diploma of Beauty Therapy

schools.degreeSpec: Masters of Childhood and Youth Studies
schools.description: The Master of Childhood and Youth Studies is designed to meet the needs of people working, or intending to work, with children, young people and their families. Students can also study a Graduate Certificate (4 units) instead of the Masters degree.The course aims to develop the knowledge and skills of professionals, enabling them to respond more effectively to the issues that impact children, young people and families across a diverse range of contexts. It incorporates the latest research and explores the ways that children, childhood and youth are conceptualised within family, community and international settings, including the theories, policies and practices that can inform professional practice. Participants benefit from the opportunity to apply their learning immediately in the workplace.

Caroline makes things happen, has vision, tenacity & resilience. She follows through with professionalism executing her projects overcoming challenges even when others have given up, to achieve a favourable outcome.

Caroline was the inaugural CEO of the SME Association of Australia, the first peak body in Australia to support small & medium enterprise, recognising them as key drivers for the economy of the nation. AMSA was originally established in 1970 to enable both Malaysian and Singaporean residents and their families in Sydney to meet socially and network with each other. AMSA is an autonomous community organisation which is non-profit, non-political and non-religious. The Association is fully funded by its members and corporate sponsors. It is operated and managed by an Executive Committee which comprises volunteers who willingly give their time to participate in and organise community conferences, social and business networking functions for the benefit of members, their families and the community at large.

jobs.description:
Bojun Agriculture Holdings Limited (ASX: BAH) is a company registered in New South Wales, Australia.
The Company's operating entity is Jiangxi Bojun Ecological Agriculture Development Co. Ltd (referred to as "Jiang Xi Bojun"), established in China. From the chart below, the Company has controls over the business and economic rights of Jiangxi Bojun.
Jiangxi Bojun was incorporated in April 2006, the registered capital is RMB 25 million yuan. The main products are fruit vinegar and fruit cakes. Jiangxi Bojun is a comprehensive and technical agricultural company which integrates production, scientific research, promotion, deep processing of agricultural products and is also a planting and deep processing enterprise of Nanfeng mandarins. Nanfeng mandarins cultivation provides high quality raw materials for R & D for fruit vinegar and fruit cakes, as well as support the required experimental data. The Company fully passed the certification of ISO22000-2005 Authentication Certificate of food safety management system and was granted National High-tech Enterprise, Model Enterprise of Food Processing and Provincial Leading Enterprise of Fruit Industry in Jiangxi Province.
Jiangxi Bojun is the first and only company which has the capability and technology to produce mandarin fruit vinegar and possesses the patents for production of mandarin fruit vinegar. Meanwhile the Company also possesses the patents for production of Nanfeng mandarin orange fruitcake, and provides trademark franchising service for other enterprises.
Look into the future, the Company will further enhance its R&D strength to promote the Company's main product diversification, further enhancing its market expansion and increase market share and extend industrial chain to promote sustained and healthy development of enterprise operation.

jobs.companyName: Global Sichuan Entrepreneurs Business Council 全球川商总会
jobs.jobTitle: Executive Deputy President 常务副会长
jobs.description:
龙出夔门济天下，游子思归哺桑梓。
　　古往今来，一代又一代川商不畏艰险、披荆斩棘，用智慧和汗水开拓千里栈道、茶马古道和南方丝绸之路， 让灿若朝霞的蜀锦、茗香四溢的川茶、醇厚绵柔的川酒走向五湖四海。
　　在经济全球化大背景下，抱团发展、互惠共赢成为企业发展的必然选择。在省委、省政府的大力支持和直接倡导下，2016 年 2 月 23 日，由境内外川籍商会，刘永好、王健林等全球知名川籍企业家，四川发展(控股)公司等川内大型国有企业自愿结成的非营利性社会组织“四川省川商总会”(简称川商总会)在成都应运而生。推举新希望集团董事长刘永好先生担任会长，推荐万达集团董事长王健林先生担任名誉会长。
　　川商总会坚持“凝聚全球川商力量，引导川商返乡兴业”的宗旨， 以成就川商、繁荣家乡为己任，致力成为培养川商领袖企业家的摇篮，打造具有全球影响力的卓越商帮。目前，川商总会已初步建成一个具有代表性、引领性、标杆性的会员架构，基础会员总量近 30000 家，核心圈层理事 105 家，理事企业平均年营收约 150 亿元。
　　作为全球川商力量的凝聚者和引领者，我们努力搭建川商发展优良生态圈。四川省副书记、省长尹力亲自联系川商总会，省政府每年春节后上班第一天就组织召开川商座谈会听取川商意见。川商总会与四川省直主要经济部门及 21 个市州政府的常态化联络沟通机制已基本构建;与近 60 家海内外省级(区域)四川商会建立起了紧密联系;与浙商、深商、桂商等国内知名商帮，中国卢森堡商会等国内境外商会的战略合作关系已形成。
　　作为全球川商发展的支持者和服务者，我们全力夯实综合性基础服务体系。重点专注四大目标——支持川商各类项目较快落地、推动川商发展所需资源迅速整合、协调川商发展各类问题有效解决、共享川商发展各类价值信息。成立以来，川商总会为川商提供政策指导、产业融通、推介咨询等服务的重点项目超过 20 个，深度介入新能源、现代农业等行业 8 个重大投资项目落地，累计促成川商签订各类投资协议 24 个，涉及金额超过 1000 亿元。
　　作为全球川商投资合作平台的创造者和提供者，我们致力打造承载数百亿甚至上千亿的投资载体或渠道。川商总会精准发力“川商云 + 基金群”、“总会 + 产业园区”、“川商投资发展联合体”三大主题，全面探索川商之间深度抱团互动发展，互联网大数据与产业投资互为支撑、集群集聚发展与特色园区建设充分融合的合作发展新路径、新方式。以 “全球川商返乡创新创意产业园(川商之家、川商博物馆)”、“川商基金”、“跨境电商基金”、“川商溢思基金”等为代表的重点项目加速推进，全面开启了全球川商共赢合作发展新篇章。
　　“商行大道，扎起·雄起”是新时期川商精神的集中诠释。川商发展要行大道，遵纪守法，坚定落实党和政府战略部署;川商之间要相互支持，抱团共赢未来;川商要用加快发展壮大为经济社会发展做出更大的贡献。这种精神是川商之魂，永远不会褪色、永远不会过时，这种精神将在川商总会这个全球川商共同的大家庭中，得到更好的聚集与传承。

general.headline: CEO at Australia China Business Council Vic
general.description:
Virginia joined the Australia China Business Council Victoria (ACBC) as CEO in August 2014. Her primary responsibilities are to optimise the performance and strategic growth of ACBC Victoria and to ensure the 300+ companies who make up the branch in city, metropolitan and regional areas are provided with key training, policy advice and strategic networking activities to grow their business opportunities with China. She has created a training program for SME's and a Future Leaders' Forum to assist young entrepreneurs to make the right connections and gain appropriate training to take their businesses from concept stage into the China market.  She also established the ACBC Vic Executive Women's Forum to specifically assist women doing bi-lateral business between Australia and China.
She works in close liaison with the ACBC Victoria Executive Committee, the branch's sector-specific Working Groups, Austrade, DFAT, Federal and State Governments, the China Chamber of Commerce in Australia, the Chinese Consulate and with over 3,000 individuals connected with the Victorian branch.
Prior to joining the ACBC, Virginia was Director of Ivanhoe Professional Learning, which she established in 2007 as a commercial division of Ivanhoe Grammar School to service the professional development requirements of primary and secondary teachers across Australia. In addition to this position, she held the simultaneous role of Manager of the Principal’s Administration at the school for 10 years, directly responsible to the Principal and Board of Governors.  
Her career includes three years as Events and Special Projects Manager at the Committee for Melbourne and six years as the CEO of the Belgian-Luxembourg Chamber of Commerce.  
She holds a Diploma of Business Administration, is a Board Member of the Australia-China Health Accelerator and Chair of the ACBC Victoria Executive Women’s Forum.

For over 20 years she has been involved in recreational sport aviation and has a pilot’s licence.

general.fullName: Andrea Myles 麦舒岚 - China Geek
general.headline: China 中国 + Innovation 创新  + Entrepreneurship 创业 | CEO | Speaker | Consultant
general.description:
Andrea Myles, CEO China Australia Millennial Project (CAMP) 

I love China. Since travelling to China as a young backpacker on my first ever adventure overseas, I've been hooked. 

My career has China at it's heart and is sector agnostic. In short, I help others connect to the difficult market of China in ways which don't suck. I also make lots of videos on LinkedIn. 

Since my first trip, I've gained two bilingual Masters degrees in Chinese business & culture from the University of Technology, Sydney via Yunnan Normal University & the National Political University, Taipei, have lived in China for 5+ years, worked on social enterprise programs in regional China, headed up the Australia China Business Council, lead the business delegation of then Prime Minister Gillard's second trip to China & co-founded the Engaging China Project - a government-recognised best-practice China engagement program in Australian high schools. 

I studied a BSc in Neuroscience from the University of Sydney & am a fellow of the School for Social Entrepreneurs & the Sydney Leadership Program. I also co-founded the Sydney Roller Derby League.

What frustrates me is the transactional nature of the Australia-China relationship. I'm impatient for positive change, which is why I co-founded the highly-successful China Australia Millennial Project to connect leading talent in both nations via a world first incubator & social change program, insights arm, consulting and more.

I've been named one of Australia's 100 Most Influential Women by Westpac & the Australian Financial Review, am a UTS Alumni of the Year & was a finalist in the Emerging Entrepreneur category of the NAB Leadership Awards. 

I sit on the City of Sydney Chinese New Year Advisory Panel & the UTS Faculty of Arts & Social Sciences Industry Advisory Board and the University of Sydney Business School Board of Advice.

jobs.description:
The China Australia Millennial Project (CAMP) Summit unites 100 young innovators aged 18-35 from China and Australia for a 5 day innovation incubator within Vivid Ideas Festival. During this 5 day experience, these young leaders will build skills for the Asian Century, be mentored by global change-makers and experience additional networking, skill building and industry-related activities.
The 130-strong group will provide fresh perspectives and co-create new projects which address problems that are common to both countries. In the process, relationships and long-term and short term networks will develop between peers of emerging leaders and early-career creative thinkers from the two nations.
We’re building partnerships with government, business and community, the ball is definitely rolling fast on this project and we would love to collaborate with you.
CAMP Returns in 2016 with 200 new young leaders.  Stay tuned at www.australiachina.org

The Engaging China Project sends out ambassadors to high schools to impart their real-world experiences and stories of engaging with China or learning Chinese with students across Australia. Our Engaging China Project Ambassadors have experienced first-hand the amazing opportunities that engaging with China opens up for young people and know well that the future Australia-China relationship lies in the hands of today’s young. In our workshops and online, we tell real stories about what it’s like to start the China adventure. We demystify China and make it “cool”. 
To date we have reached out to over 12,000 young people across the country and had a great time doing our bit for the Asian Century.

ACBC plays a leading role in the Sino-Australian bilateral relationship and has been the principal organiser of the Australia China Economic and Trade Cooperation Forums in Beijing and Canberra.

To survive and thrive in the 21st century we must adapt and discover new solutions to our most stubborn and pervasive problems. Finding lasting solutions calls for a higher order of working, thinking and connection, and it requires private enterprise, government and NGOs to start working together in new ways.This is the opportunity that Sydney Leadership provides.Each year it brings together a diverse group of talented and motivated individuals who can share ideas, challenge each others’ views and work together to develop the insights, skills and connections which are the foundation fo effective leadership in an increasingly complex world.

The mission of the School for Social Entrepreneurs Australia is to address inequalities and social exclusion by supporting social entrepreneurs from all backgrounds to transform their talent into real social outcomes, in the form of sustainable solutions to poverty and disadvantage in communities. general.headline: Keynote Speaker, Thought Leader and Business Futurist - China Expert
general.description:
Every company, whether big or small, must have a China strategy - they are simply too important for you to ignore.

Unlike Western democracies, China has a clear, succinct and well-documented long-term strategy. It is a “planned economy”, so when it says it’s going to do something, it almost inevitably does.

This gives you clear direction on the sectors, industries and opportunities to focus on.

Therefore there are many short and medium term opportunities for business leaders, entrepreneurs and investors like you, including opportunities to tap into the wave of Chinese people, capital and resources moving towards your home country.

However, getting your business involved with China is rarely a simple process.

That’s where my specialty lies.

My passion is educating global business leaders, entrepreneurs and investors about the massive potential offered by modern China. I do this by helping you identify, build and facilitate long-term business and investment relationships.

Having spent 30 years on the ground in Asia, I have worked with businesses from many industry sectors, including Agriculture, Education, Financial Services, as well as HealthCare, Renewable Energy, Retail, Tourism and Real Estate.

Contact me at support@davidthomas.asia to discuss having me speak at your next Conference, Leadership seminar, Strategy session or Board meeting to share my knowledge, stories, case studies and insights with your clients and colleagues.

Or go to my web site www.davidthomas.asia to learn more about my China journey, read my blog or to download one of my free e-books

jobs.description:
My experience, connections and networks have accumulated over a 30 year career in London,  Hong Kong and Sydney. I managed my own financial services business in Hong Kong for 8 years (1987 - 1995) which provided unique insights and first hand experience of  the changing landscape within the Asia  Pacific region, particularly the opening up of China, the rise of Japan  and the Asian tigers, and the emergence of India. More recently, my influence and activities have extended to Latin America and Eastern Europe driven by my interest and passion for the economic potential and growing influence of the four "BRIC countries" (Brazil, Russia, India and China).

As a regular speaker in Conferences and Boardrooms around the world, I work with entrepreneurs, investors and business leaders to help them engage with the new economic powerhouses of the 21st Century

SMEs represent over 99.7% of all companies in Australia and employ 70% of Australia's working population. They include some of the most dynamic, entrepreneurial and innovative businesses in the region and form the backbone of Australia's economy. 

ACSME's aim is to build a platform for SMEs to join together as members, friends and investors and to invite Governments and industry leaders to understand and appreciate the important contribution being made by SME business leaders to the strength and sustainability of the Sino-Australian relationship.

Think Global Consulting facilitates business and investment between Asia and Australia. We work with individuals, entrepreneurs, companies and institutions to build viable, sustainable and powerful connections by leveraging our networks and relationships in both developed and emerging markets.

We advise our clients on market entry and business development, and manage investments sourced from China and the Asia Pacific region into a range of attractive sectors, including Agriculture, Resources, Education, Renewable Energy, Technology, Property Development and Financial Services.

We work with a number of leading Australian institutions to meet the objectives of our clients and to maximise all opportunities. Our approach is open, collaborative and focused on delivering results.

The Emerging Markets Masters Fund was established to provide Australian investors with the opportunity to gain access to leading global fund products and managers specialising in the global emerging markets equity asset class. general.headline: Executive Talent Specialist at Transport for NSW - Sydney Trains
general.description:
Facilitating over a million trips a day, Sydney Trains operates quick, frequent and reliable trains in the greater Sydney suburban area. We offer employees interesting, challenging and rewarding work, as well as a unique employment experience concentrated on career progression, learning and flexibility. 

There's a bright new future for railways in NSW. Career opportunities with Sydney Trains represent real and exciting change in workplace culture. We're looking for people who want to focus on customer service and make a difference to commuters'​ every day experience. 

Sydney Trains operates as a function of Transport for New South Wales who employs more than 25,000 people across a range of industries and professions. Sydney Trains aims to employ the most talented people to work for our organisation who are committed to delivering services for our customers and contributing to a safe, reliable and efficient transport network. 

For current career opportunities please visit our careers page at http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sydneytrains/careers

Key Facts - 1.3 million customer journeys every weekday - 400 million customer journeys annually - 178 stations - Maintains over 2000 electric and diesel cars - Each 8-car double deck train carries 1000+ customers - Maintains 1643 km of track, including 961 km of electrified track - Manages $37 billion of assets - Total cost of operations $2.8 billion

As an operating company of Randstad and the second largest HR services provider in the world, Randstad Sourceright delivers the resources and deep capability companies need to optimize their talent strategy for business growth and transformation.

general.headline: Senior Associate at Herbert Smith Freehills
general.description: Experienced leader in Complex Finance with a demonstrated history of working in the legal practice and finance industry. Highly skilled in Banking, Debt Restructuring, Structured Finance, and Corporate Finance with a proven ability over 10 years to manage teams and execute transactions, and identify, allocate and mitigate risk in a commercial manner.  Trusted with some of the most technically complex transactions in the market. Strong professional with a Master of Laws (LLM) focused in Banking, Corporate, Finance, and Securities Law from University of Sydney. Also, yoga teacher and business co-founder.

jobs.jobTitle: Senior Associate (restructuring, leveraged and structured finance)
jobs.description:
Herbert Smith Freehills is a major international law firm with over 2,100 attorneys across the globe. In Australia, Herbert Smith Freehills is a Tier 1 law firm with a client base comprising the vast majority of Australia’s top 100 listed corporates and a deep field of international organisations.  

James has wide experience in advising institutional banks, investment banks, private equity firms and corporates on a range of complex banking and finance transactions and utilising sophisticated securitisation and structured finance technologies to achieve client outcomes. Clients range from senior, mezzanine and junior lenders, borrowers, vendors and purchasers. 

James has advised on some of the most significant financing transactions in the Global and Asia-Pacific markets in recent history. This includes the highly complex cross border financing of Key Safety System's acquisition of Takata through multiple bankruptcy proceedings across 31 jurisdictions, and the multi-award winning financing of GE's disposal of its A$8.2bn credit card loan book to a consortium led by KKR, Varde Partners and Deutsche Bank.

Providing cross division coverage across all legal risk areas for Maia Financial. Collaborating with the Legal & Risk team as well as directly with Business teams to achieve Maia Financial's goals of delivering Australian businesses with smart capital for growth. A fast paced experience and honing an understanding of what Clients and Customers really care about: value, risk and execution.

Solicitor in Ashurst's finance practice, working on securitisations (including Australia's
      
      first covered bonds issue) and front end acquisitions.
Trading options against Australian listed equities and KOSPI derivatives.

Formerly Student Marketing Australia. The role involved developing pitches and
      running team-based marketing campaigns for Apple Inc, Commonwealth Bank of
      
      Australia  and the AEC. An excellent incubator for teamwork and communication skills.

general.headline: Head of Legal, Property Projects at Lendlease
general.description: I am the Head of Legal, Property Projects at Lendlease.  Prior to joining Lendlease, I was a Partner at Herbert Smith Freehills.  My main areas of expertise are commercial property developments and transactions ranging from portfolio sales and purchases, fund through sales, commercial office leasing, retail leasing, large scale residential land developments and major infrastructure projects.

jobs.description:
I worked in the Finance, Real Estate and Projects Group at Herbert Smith Freehills.  Some of my transactions during my time at Herbert Smith Freehills included:
•	Advising Leighton Properties on its fund through sale of the proposed CIMIC Group Headquarters at North Sydney to ARA/Suntec REIT, on its fund through sale of 567 Collins Street, Melbourne to Investa and on its fund through sale of 3 commercial office towers in Kings Square, Perth to Dexus.
•	Advising Lendlease on its acquisition of the St George Bank commercial office towers at Circular Quay, Sydney from Westpac Banking Corporation.
•	Advising Allegra Holdings on its acquisition of the Bulgari Building, 64 Castlereagh Street, Sydney.
•	Advising Austreo Property Ventures Pty Ltd (a subsidiary of Goldman Sachs) on its acquisition of the commercial office buildings at 157 Ann Street, Brisbane and 168 Walker Street, North Sydney.
•	Advising Leighton Properties on its joint venture arrangements with Qualitas for residential projects at Bondi Junction and Moonee Ponds.
•	Advising Group Zara Australia and Zara Home Australia on their expansion into the Australian market including negotiation and execution of agreements for lease for the construction of and leasing of new retail premises throughout Australia.

My role at Inditex included providing advice on various matters for both the parent company and the retail subsidiaries (i.e. Zara, Zara Home, Massimo Dutti, Bershka, Stradivarius and Pull & Bear). My main focus was on real estate and construction issues with respect to the expansion of the brands in both the UK & Ireland and the management of the portfolio of 110 stores in the UK and Ireland. I was also involved in the commercial aspects of the business including providing strategic advice and reporting directly to the Board.

While at Linklaters I was a Managing Associate in the real estate team specialising in
      all areas of property development, project finance transactions, acquisitions and
      
      disposals.

I worked in the real estate team of the London office of Clifford Chance.  My main focus
      
      was on real estate acquisitions and disposals.

While at Mallesons I was a Senior Associate in the Projects and Infrastructure Group
      specialising in real estate development, disposals, acquisitions and the real estate
      
      aspects of insolvency transactions.

I was a solicitor in the Projects and Infrastructure Group at Corrs Chambers Westgarth
      
      specialising in real estate acquisitions and disposals and residential developments.

While at Mayer Brown (formerly Rowe & Maw), I worked as a paralegal in the
      Corporate, Banking and Projects Group with a particular focus on precedent
      
      development and fee earner training.

I was a paralegal at this law practice prior to commencing 5 years articles of clerkship with this firm whilst completing my law degree part time.  My main focus during this period was on drafting and negotiation of contracts for the sale of businesses, commercial and residential property as well as dealing with estate matters and general litigation matters.
